bug.short_desc: Searching on a link list page interferes with the floating status bar

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
When searching on a page that contains many links, the status bar pops up when a match was found inside a link. Also, the search match will be placed in the bottom-most line in the window. Consequently, the match is obscured by the status bar.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open the page from the URL field above 2. Search for "telnet" 3. Click anywhere outside the found link 4. Continue searching Actual Results: After a few more matches, you cannot see the match highlighting anymore.
Expected Results: I expect the search match highlighting to be clearly visible. There's two solutions for it.
1. Put that status bar out of the way. 2. (preferred one) Scroll the search match more into the view, not to the outer-most line of the window. This also allows for better seeing the context around that match. Right now, I always have to scroll a bit further when something was found.
I was not able to reproduce the issue. If possible, can you attach some screenshots?
Screenshots of something that is not visible? Or can you recommend me a screen-video-recorder software?

AndreiD, what do you see when searching on the page? Is the floating status bar out of the way? Is is not visible at all? Does the page scroll the match more into the view? Does it find nothing at all?
If it makes a difference, I have enabled Find As You Type and just started typing "telnet", not pressing Ctrl+F or something before.
Is the issue described here similar to the one reported in bug 631270?

Maybe. But theirs is fixed, mine is not. There must be a difference. Notice the click (or even mouse hovering the status bar) before continuing the search with F3!
